meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling limonite.
meanings.sent1: The limonitic rocks had a yellowish-brown color.
meanings.sent2: The soil in the area was limonitic, giving it a rusty appearance.
meanings.sent3: The limonitic stones looked like they were painted with mustard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as limonitic minerals in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The limonitic texture of the wall made it rough to touch.

meanings.sent1: The limonitic soil was perfect for growing certain plants.
meanings.sent2: The old mine had limonitic deposits that sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent3: The limonitic paint on the fence made it blend in with the surroundings.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a limonitic quality, deep and rich.
meanings.sent5: The limonitic appearance of the rock made it stand out from the others.

meanings.sent1: The limonitic surface of the statue showed its age.
meanings.sent2: The limonitic water stains on the wall were hard to remove.
meanings.sent3: The limonitic footprints on the floor led to a surprising discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her hands were limonitic from working in the garden all day.
meanings.sent5: The limonitic hue of the metal gate hinted at its long exposure to the elements.
